channel.title: Circular blade [WOULD YOU LIKE THE BLADE HOW IT IS OR SKINNY?]
channel.description:
[b]Well thanks to dylan im moving on to swords. Ive only just started modeling and such. As i am only experienced in coding server's/clients.[/b][quote="dylan_0789, post:6, topic:273346"]thats being pretty generous... id only give the actual jagex model a 1/5, then he adds primitives and recolors it and suddenly its "his" model. 0.3291134/5 why not just make a sword? sure, their basic but atleast then you could say its yours and be telling the truth... unless you recolor it.[/quote]
Here's a picture on what i had been working on. [IMG]http://i438.photobucket.com/albums/qq110/Mason_013/Ancient1.jpg[/img]
Please dont be harsh as it is my [b]first sword[/b] model.
[i]Im not sure about if everyone does this. But the sword is made out of [b]only primitive[/b].[/i]

item.title: Circular blade [WOULD YOU LIKE THE BLADE HOW IT IS OR SKINNY?]
item.dc:creator: @time_of_rune time of rune
item.description:
@time_of_rune wrote:

I would make a v2 before you try and release it. Fix a couple things, and go into a bit more detail, and it should then be ready to release. (the reason my writing was so messed up earlier, was because i was typing at 6am :P)

Read full topic

Thats a bit unappropriate.

Yeah,
And I think you should realse it, I like it, Lol.

Lol i will once i figure out how to Gzip it =)

Download anyzip great program
http://www.shareup.com/AnyZip-download-31409.html
[/quote]

Ive got 7-Zip is that any good. If it is how do i use it?[/quote]

If you do the following steps with 7-zip end u spot gzip it schould work if not download anyzip

item.title: Circular blade [WOULD YOU LIKE THE BLADE HOW IT IS OR SKINNY?]
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

[quote=“koolgordon, post:2, topic:273475”]Circuler Wave might be a good name…
Awesome for first model.[/quote][quote=“dylan_0789, post:3, topic:273475”]THERE ya go. alot better than ‘your’ plate body. and this is a forum where alot of ppl trace images… I prefer to use primitives… well, basically i use a cube and make a weapon out of it. stick to primitive modelling, thats how it should be done. thats what graphic designers do.(ofcourse alot use reference images though =P)[/quote][quote=“time of rune, post:4, topic:273475”]Looks great for a first model! (as dylan said, stick to primitive modeling.) The only thing wrong with it is the spikes aren’t aligned straight, and next time, take lines and points off for the screenshot. Other than that, Good Job! :)[/quote]

Thanks guys.
Hmm i guess the spikes would look better if they were straight.

Read full topic
item.source: Circular blade [WOULD YOU LIKE THE BLADE HOW IT IS OR SKINNY?]

item.title: Circular blade [WOULD YOU LIKE THE BLADE HOW IT IS OR SKINNY?]
item.dc:creator: @time_of_rune time of rune
item.description:
@time_of_rune wrote:

Looks great for a first model! (as dylan said, stick to primitive modeling.) The only thing wrong with it is the spikes aren’t aligned straight, and next time, take lines and points off for the screenshot. Other than that, Good Job!

Read full topic

item.title: Circular blade [WOULD YOU LIKE THE BLADE HOW IT IS OR SKINNY?]

item.description:
@dylan_0789 wrote:

THERE ya go. alot better than ‘your’ plate body. and this is a forum where alot of ppl trace images… I prefer to use primitives… well, basically i use a cube and make a weapon out of it. stick to primitive modelling, thats how it should be done. thats what graphic designers do.(ofcourse alot use reference images though =P)
